messages.message: Thanks Varun! So we are not allowed to look at their files / data to improve the product? What kind of user feedback can be used then? Just a thumbs up/down doesn’t really tell us what to improve.

There are two types of user feedback we capture:
1. In chat feedback - in addition to thumb up and down, for negative feedback we ask people to pick from options on what the problem was. Users can also provide qualitative feedback. All of this is captured in the chats.json file and can be mined for improvement. (screenshot attached) 
2. We also have a generic google form to capture overall feedback from the users. 
Both of these can be used to improve the product and model dev performance.
Gotcha! In the case of the thumbs down though, we are not allowed to see their actual file to determine how we might improve extraction?
yeah same question -- just knowing the user thinks the answer is inaccurate is not helpful, need to know the question / prompt and the file
That’s my understanding from a legal / privacy point of view. @Jarett can confirm.
let's regroup to talk about this with Clemens and Anant -- I understand for enterprise users we have different agreement, but i was expecting different things for prosumers
We have more flexibility for prosumers
Let’s definitely discuss. There are several different ways to approach this
Most professionals and small businesses I have interviewed won’t be comfortable using AI hub, if we can examine their data.
Let's bring this back to the internal group
Yes, that is a concern- however we can also have them grant permission if/when they want help troubleshooting an issue
It’s a good discussion to have

are there exceptions we make for employees? @ fb there was certain user data (e.g. traces or internal tool, def not all user data) from employees that was more visible internally for debugging purposes compared to public users.

not sure if we want to be able to debug issues w/ employee submitted docs in the current preview/future prod - sounds like that's not possible today
That’s a good suggestion @peter - we will check how we can leverage that
